holidays.name: Pickle Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the humble pickle, that tangy, crunchy delight that jazzes up sandwiches, salads, and snack platters around the world.
holidays.origin: Pickle Day is an unofficial food holiday that likely emerged from pickle enthusiasts and makers who wanted to honor this salty treat.

holidays.name: World Diabetes Day
holidays.description: A global awareness day focusing on diabetes, its prevention, management, and the importance of holistic health.
holidays.origin: Established by the International Diabetes Federation in 1991 and marked on November 14 to honor Frederick Banting, who co-discovered insulin.
holidays.funFact: The blue circle symbolizing the day represents the unity of the global diabetes community.

holidays.name: Operating Room Nurse Day
holidays.description: A day to recognize the critical role of nurses who work in operating rooms, providing skillful, behind-the-scenes care during surgeries.
holidays.origin: An unofficial appreciation day created by professional nursing organizations to honor OR nurses.
